quizzes.question: Rearrange the code to open a file, output its contents and delete it.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Deleting Files[/h1]

We can delete a file using the File.[b]delete [/b]method.
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="rb" ]File.[b]delete[/b]("test.txt")[/code]
[note]Be careful, as this command deletes the file permanently.[/note]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to open a file and output its contents if the file exists. Otherwise, output the corresponding error message.
[!raw!]
{0} File.{1}("demo.txt")
    f = File.open("demo.txt", "r")
    puts f.{2}
    {3}.close
{4}
    puts "File does not exist"
end
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Working with Files[/h1]

When working with files, it is important to first check if the file exists in order to prevent an error.
The [b]file?[/b] method provides an easy way of checking if the file exists.
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="rb" ]File.open("test.txt") if File.[b]file?[/b]("text.txt")[/code]
The code above tests whether a file exists before opening it.
[note]File.file? returns [b]true [/b]if the file exists, and [b]false [/b]if it does not.[/note]
